question: 震度
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>earthquake</kanji> <kanji>degree</kanji>s is how you measure an earthquake. The <ja>震度</ja> is the <vocabulary>earthquake intensity</vocabulary>, AKA <vocabulary>earthquake magnitude</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>seismic intensity</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>seismic scale</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
